FuncDef:
The idle-code-e1 command configures a subcard to send a specific bit stream to notify an idle E1 channel timeslot.
The undo idle-code-e1 command restores the default configuration.
By default, a subcard sends the 0x0 bit stream to notify an idle E1 channel timeslot.

ParaDef.Info:
The value can be 0x0 or 0xFF, in hexadecimal notation.
The value ranges from 0 to ff , in hexadecimal notation.

Specifies a subcard ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 4294967295.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In unstructured data transfer for CES scenarios (SAToP), to enable a local subcard to notify an AC-side device of network-side PW faults on the subcard, run the idle-code-e1 command to configure the subcard to send the bit stream 0xFF to notify an idle E1 channel timeslot. Then, if network-side PW faults occur, the subcard can quickly and continuously send AIS bit streams to the AC-side device.
Precautions
This command is supported only on CR5D00C4CF70, CR5D00C8CF71, CR5D00C2CF70,CR5D00C2CF71 subcards.
